translation: (1) By those [angels] lined up in rows
(2) And those who drive [the clouds]
(3) And those who recite the message,[1286]
footnotes: [1286]- To the prophets or among themselves.  Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) swears by these three kinds of angels to the fact mentioned in the following verse.

translation: (4) Indeed, your God is One,

arabic_text: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ
translation: (5) Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.[1287]
footnotes: [1287]- i.e., each point or place of sunrise.

arabic_text: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ
translation: (6) Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
(7) And as protection against every rebellious devil

arabic_text: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَيُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٖ
translation: (8) [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,[1288]
footnotes: [1288]- By flaming meteors.

translation: (9) Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ ثَاقِبٞ
translation: (10) Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].

arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَآۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّن طِينٖ لَّازِبِۭ
translation: (11) Then inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.
(12) But you wonder, while they mock,
(13) And when they are reminded, they remember not.
(14) And when they see a sign, they ridicule.

arabic_text: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٌ
translation: (15) And say, "This is not but obvious magic.

arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
translation: (16) When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
(17) And our forefathers [as well]?"
(18) Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."

arabic_text: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَإِذَا هُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
translation: (19) It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
(20) They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."

arabic_text: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: (21) [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."

arabic_text: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ وَأَزۡوَٰجَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ
translation: (22) [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds,[1289] and what they used to worship
footnotes: [1289]- Those similar to them in evil deeds.  Another possible meaning is "their wives."

arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: (23) Other than Allāh, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
(24) And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
(25) [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
(26) But they, that Day, are in surrender.
(27) And they will approach one another asking [i.e., blaming] each other.

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: (28) They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."[1290]
footnotes: [1290]- i.e., from our position of strength, oppressing us.  Or from where we would have grasped the truth, preventing us.

translation: (29) They [i.e., the oppressors] will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,

arabic_text: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمٗا طَٰغِينَ
translation: (30) And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.

arabic_text: فَحَقَّ عَلَيۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَآۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
translation: (31) So the word [i.e., decree] of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
(32) And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
(33) So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
(34) Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ
translation: (35) Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allāh," were arrogant

arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٖ مَّجۡنُونِۭ
translation: (36) And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
(37) Rather, he [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
(38) Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

arabic_text: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: (39) And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
(40) But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
(41) Those will have a provision determined -
(42) Fruits;[1291] and they will be honored
footnotes: [1291]- Meaning everything delicious.

translation: (43) In gardens of pleasure
(44) On thrones facing one another.
(45) There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
(46) White and delicious to the drinkers;

arabic_text: لَا فِيهَا غَوۡلٞ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا يُنزَفُونَ
translation: (47) No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
(48) And with them will be women limiting [their] glances,[1292] with large, [beautiful] eyes,
footnotes: [1292]- i.e., chaste and modest, looking only at their mates.

translation: (49) As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
(50) And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

arabic_text: قَالَ قَآئِلٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٞ
translation: (51) A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth].
(52) Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
translation: (53) That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
(54) He will say,[1293] "Would you [care to] look?"
footnotes: [1293]- To his companions in Paradise.

translation: (55) And he will look and see him[1294] in the midst of the Hellfire.
footnotes: [1294]- The companion who had tried to dissuade him from belief on earth.

translation: (56) He will say, "By Allāh, you almost ruined me.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِينَ
translation: (57) If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
(58) Then, are we not to die

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
translation: (59) Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
(60) Indeed, this is the great attainment.
(61) For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

arabic_text: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
translation: (62) Is that [i.e., Paradise] a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqūm?
(63) Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

arabic_text: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٞ تَخۡرُجُ فِيٓ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: (64) Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
(65) Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَأٓكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ
translation: (66) And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا لَشَوۡبٗا مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ
translation: (67) Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
(68) Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
(69) Indeed they found their fathers astray.
(70) So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
(71) And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
(72) And We had already sent among them warners.
(73) Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
(74) But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
(75) And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
(76) And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
(77) And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
(78) And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
(79) "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
(80) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(81) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
(82) Then We drowned the others [i.e., disbelievers].
(83) And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
(84) When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
translation: (85) [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
(86) Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allāh you desire?
(87) Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
(88) And he cast a look at the stars
(89) And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
(90) So they turned away from him, departing.

arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
translation: (91) Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?[1295]
footnotes: [1295]- Consume the offerings placed before them.

translation: (92) What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"
(93) And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
(94) Then they [i.e., the people] came toward him, hastening.
(95) He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
(96) While Allāh created you and that which you do?"

arabic_text: قَالُواْ ٱبۡنُواْ لَهُۥ بُنۡيَٰنٗا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِي ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: (97) They said, "Construct for him a structure [i.e., furnace] and throw him into the burning fire."
(98) And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the most debased.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ
translation: (99) And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
(100) My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
(101) So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
translation: (102) And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion,[1296] he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allāh wills, of the steadfast."
footnotes: [1296]- i.e., the ability to work and be of assistance.

translation: (103) And when they had both submitted[1297] and he put him down upon his forehead,
footnotes: [1297]- To the command of Allāh.

translation: (104) We called to him, "O Abraham,

arabic_text: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡيَآۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ
translation: (105) You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(106) Indeed, this was the clear trial.
(107) And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,[1298]
footnotes: [1298]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) sent a huge ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.

translation: (108) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
(109) "Peace upon Abraham."
(110) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(111) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
(112) And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.[1299]
footnotes: [1299]- This verifies that the firstborn son who was to be sacrificed was Ishmael and not Isaac, as claimed by the Jews and Christians.

arabic_text: وَبَٰرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسۡحَٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنٞ وَظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِينٞ
translation: (113) And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself [i.e., sinner].
(114) And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
(115) And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
(116) And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
(117) And We gave them the explicit Scripture [i.e., the Torah],
(118) And We guided them on the straight path.
(119) And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
(120) "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
(121) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(122) Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
(123) And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
(124) When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(125) Do you call upon Baʿl[1300] and leave the best of creators -
footnotes: [1300]- The name of a great idol worshipped by the people and said to mean "lord."

translation: (126) Allāh, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
(127) And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
(128) Except the chosen servants of Allāh.
(129) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
(130) "Peace upon Elias."[1301]
footnotes: [1301]- Ilyāseen is said by some commentators to be a plural form, meaning "Elias and those who followed him."

translation: (131) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(132) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
(133) And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
(134) [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
(135) Except an old woman [i.e., his wife] among those who remained [with the evildoers].
(136) Then We destroyed the others.
(137) And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
(138) And at night. Then will you not use reason?
(139) And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
(140) [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
(141) And he drew lots[1302] and was among the losers.
footnotes: [1302]- To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the other passengers.  Having been overloaded, the ship was on the verge of sinking.

translation: (142) Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.[1303]
footnotes: [1303]- For having given up hope on his people prematurely and having left them without permission from Allāh.

translation: (143) And had he not been of those who exalt Allāh,

arabic_text: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطۡنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
translation: (144) He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.[1304]
footnotes: [1304]- Meaning that the belly of the fish would have become his grave.

translation: (145) But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
(146) And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.[1305]
footnotes: [1305]- Which is known to give cooling shade and to be a repellent of flies.

arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِاْئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ يَزِيدُونَ
translation: (147) And We sent him[1306] to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
footnotes: [1306]- i.e., returned him thereafter.

translation: (148) And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
(149) So inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?[1307]
footnotes: [1307]- The people of Makkah claimed that the angels were daughters of Allāh, yet they preferred sons for themselves.

arabic_text: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثٗا وَهُمۡ شَٰهِدُونَ
translation: (150) Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
(151) Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
(152) "Allāh has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
(153) Has He chosen daughters over sons?
(154) What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
(155) Then will you not be reminded?
(156) Or do you have a clear authority?[1308]
footnotes: [1308]- i.e., evidence.

translation: (157) Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلُواْ بَيۡنَهُۥ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبٗاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ
translation: (158) And they have made [i.e., claimed] between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought [to punishment].
(159) Exalted is Allāh above what they describe,
(160) Except the chosen servants of Allāh [who do not share in that sin].
(161) So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
(162) You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
(163) Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.[1309]
footnotes: [1309]- Due to his disbelief and evil deeds.

arabic_text: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
translation: (164) [The angels say],[1310] "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.[1311]
footnotes: [1310]- Refuting what the disbelievers had said about them. [1311]- For worship.  Or "an assigned task" to perform.

translation: (165) And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
(166) And indeed, we are those who exalt Allāh."
(167) And indeed, they [i.e., the disbelievers] used to say,[1312]
footnotes: [1312]- Before the revelation of the Qur’ān.

arabic_text: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: (168) "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
(169) We would have been the chosen servants of Allāh."
(170) But they disbelieved in it,[1313] so they are going to know.
footnotes: [1313]- i.e., in their own message, the Qur’ān.

translation: (171) And Our word [i.e., decree] has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
(172) [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
(173) And [that] indeed, Our soldiers [i.e., the believers] will be those who overcome.[1314]
footnotes: [1314]- If not in this world, then definitely in the Hereafter.

translation: (174) So, [O Muḥammad], leave them for a time.
(175) And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
(176) Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
translation: (177) But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
(178) And leave them for a time.
(179) And see, for they are going to see.

arabic_text: سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
translation: (180) Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
(181) And peace upon the messengers.
(182) And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.
